moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8
comment: This alternative to 7...g6 seems to be more reliable for Black, despite the unavailability of castling.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3
comment: The same idea as the previous game. With the pawn sacrifice White can achieve a significant initiative. After 8.Nge2 c5 9.0-0-0 Nxc3 10.Nxc3 Nc6 11.Nb1 c4, Black got the superior position in the old game Spielmann-Vidmar, Vienna 1907. Forget about the c3-pawn - the Chess Terrorist understands the advantages in development and the quick preparation of an attack.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6
comment: An interesting concept aimed at exchanging off one of White's strong bishops with Bc8-a6. Hort has played 10...c5 against me but did not equalize after 11.dxc5 Qa5? 12.Bd2 Qa4 13.Qb4! Qxb4 14.axb4 with a winning position for White (Shamkovich-Hort, Marianske Lasne 1965). However the up-to-date recommendation of 11...Nc6 12.Nf3 f5! is an improvement. More promising for White is likely 12.Qf4 f5 13.h4.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3
comment: Threatening 13.Rg3 g6 14.Bxg6 winning.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5
comment: 12...Bxd3 is met strongly by 13.cxd3 Nd7 14.h5 (Idea 15.Rg3). However, after the text, the g5-square becomes weak and serves as a nice outpost for the White pieces.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3
comment: White now threatens 15.Bxg6 (and also Nh3-g5). Therefore Black's reply is practically forced.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6
comment: 16...Nd7 fails to 17.Rc1.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3
comment: Liberating the g5-square for the bishop.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5
comment: Beginning a sharp counterattack.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8
comment: If 18...Qf8 19.Nf4 intending both 20.Nxe6 and 20.Ng6.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5
comment: A tense and uncompromising position has been reached. If only Black can repulse White's basic threats, he can look forward to success.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4
comment: The Black knight reenters the fray. Now White's attack is difficult.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7
comment: Not 23.Nxh5 g6! and now either 24.Be7 Rxh5, or 24.Nf4 Qh6 are winning for Black.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6
comment: My opponent once again finds the best defense. 23...Qe8 loses to 24.Nxh5 (Threat 25.Nf6+) 24...Kh8 25.Nxg7 and wins.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6
comment: The alternative 24.Bxf6 is weaker because of 24...Nf5!

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6
comment: With the new threat of 26.Ne5.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6
comment: If 25...gxf6, 26.Bxf6 is crushing.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7
comment: Black also brings his forces to the fight. A blunder would be 26...Nxe7 27.Nxe7+ Kf8 28.Ng6+ Ke8 29.Rf3! and White wins.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4
comment: Black's knights are very active and are willing to fall in battle to secure the release of their monarch.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4 29. Bf6 Nf5
comment: Necessary because of the threat of 30.Nf8. Now Black threatens both 30...Nxg3+ and 30...Rh6.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4 29. Bf6 Nf5 30. Rf3
comment: Parrying both threats. The battle reaches its peak.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4 29. Bf6 Nf5 30. Rf3 Rh6
comment: Forcing further complications which are eventually advantageous to White. But Black did not have anything better, e.g., 30...Nxg7 31.Bxg7 Qxg7 32.Rxe6 Nd4 33.Re7, or 30...Re8 31.Nf8! winning.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4 29. Bf6 Nf5 30. Rf3 Rh6 31. Rxf5 Qxg6
comment: The alternative 31...Rxg6 fails to 32.Qxh5 Rxg7 33.Bxg7 Qxh5 (33...Qxf5 34.Qh8+ Kf7 35.Qxa8 wins for White) 34.Rxh5 Kxg7 35.Rxe6 etc.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4 29. Bf6 Nf5 30. Rf3 Rh6 31. Rxf5 Qxg6 32. Rxe6 Nd4
comment: Now the position is transferred prosaically to a won ending for White.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Bb4 5. e5 h6 6. Be3 Ne4 7. Qg4 Kf8 8. a3 Bxc3+ 9. bxc3 Nxc3 10. Bd3 b6 11. h4 Ba6 12. Rh3 h5 13. Qf4 Qe7 14. Rf3 Kg8 15. Nh3 Bxd3 16. cxd3 Na6 17. Qg3 c5 18. Bg5 Qe8 19. Bf6 Qf8 20. Qg5 Nb5 21. Rg3 Rh7 22. Nf4 Nxd4 23. Be7 f6 24. exf6 Qf7 25. Ng6 Nc6 26. Kf1 Nc7 27. Re1 Nb5 28. fxg7 Nbd4 29. Bf6 Nf5 30. Rf3 Rh6 31. Rxf5 Qxg6 32. Rxe6 Nd4 33. Qxg6 Rxg6 34. Rxh5 Nxe6
comment: If 34...Rxf6 35.Rxf6 Kxg7 36.Rd6 and White wins.
